subject: Re: How would you arrange tests with jUnit?
msgSnippet: Simon, ... Definitely, and started there first!  It gave me some really good pointers and make me rethink some of my strategy! ... behaviours. ... for ...
messageBody:
Simon,

>
> Try the JUnit FAQ. This entry might be a good place to start:
>
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#tests_15
>
> There are many good pieces of information in the FAQ and I suggest
> reading it carefully.
>

Definitely, and started there first! It gave me some really good
pointers and make me rethink some of my strategy!

>
> The best thing with JUnit testing is to think in terms of
behaviours.
> What behaviour are you expecting from your system and write a test
for
> that. Do not let the fact that some behaviours span multiple objects
> while others use only a single method cause you to lose sight of the
> fact that testing is best done at the unit level and the most
workable
> unit is the unit of behaviour.
>

You make an excellent point, and something I didn't realize. I was
thinking unit testing as 'test each method of my class' and make sure
they work as expected. But really, I'm looking to test and see if my
application functionality (behaviour) works. "Can I create a report"
is what I'm really after...

Thanks again.
